project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, the sub-tasks are displayed in the *Issue Detail* tab that appears when you click on an individual issue as per the following screenshot:
!subtask_rapid.JPG!

A suggestion is to *enhance* this feature by providing an option to display under the parent issue with some sort of indentation. One of the best example would be like the one in the *Work* mode of the *Rapid Board* which uses [swimlanes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Using+Work+Mode]. As an example, the usage of *Swimlane by Queries*:
!swimlane.jpg!
fields.summary: Improvement on the current view of the Rapid Board on Sub-tasks

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be helpful to see the total issue count and the sum of estimates for a planned sprint on the same line as the name of the sprint, i.e., beside "Start Sprint", instead of at the bottom of the list of issues for the sprint.
fields.summary: Move issue count and estimate sum from the bottom of the "future sprint bracket" to the top

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The RB is a great feature in GreenHopper. We have a kanban and a scrum board with multiple projects. The board is set up to use projects as swimlanes (via JQL). 

For our organisation it is very useful to see the projects and the work each assignee has. 
Because of the large number of users a quick filter dropdown list with all possible assignees would make it easier for us to simultanously see:
* in which projects the assignee is working
* which issues are assigned to the user

Using quick filters for projects and setting the swimlanes to assignees is not an option for us. This is because:
* when selecting multiple filters for projects there are no issues belonging to two projects at the same time, so the query does not return any values
* we have to be able to see the work of one assignee at the time, with the work divided over several projects (this is due to the fact that our teammembers work in several projects simultanously)

Resolving this would be very helpful for our planners en managers.
fields.summary: User dropdown in RB quick filters

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
For example you could click on the sprint or on the backlog and the applied filters would be used and JQL generated to show the issues you are looking at on the issue navigator. 

I cant tell you how many times people have asked me for this internally. People look very confused when I tell them that you can no longer do this on a rapid board. 

Please consider this for an upcoming release.
fields.summary: As a GH6 rapid board user I need a way to jump to the issues navigator and show the issues that are selected or displayed on the planning baord

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: I don't want to remove the classic views just in case we need to go back to them, but I do want to disable the menu item so that people have to use the new rapid boards.
fields.summary: As a JIRA administrator I would like a disable classic menu item in the GH labs so that I can stop people using the classic view

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Please see the highlighted image attached for a graphical example

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The functionality for drag-and-drop transitioning is great. 

For our organisation it would also be useful to be able to drag-and-drop issues between assignee swimlanes, thus (re)assigning them. This would make the process of planning and assigning issues a lot faster and easier to use for us.
fields.summary: As a user, i would like to drag en drop assign issues

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In our organisation (100+ licenses) we have multiple projects, each with their own set of sprints. For planning and management purposes we have one Scrum Board set up for all the projects.

It would be useful for us to be able to simultanously select multiple sprints from the sprint filters. Creating a custom query everytime we complete a sprint is quite a pain for our project- and programmanagers.
fields.summary: As a user, i would like to simultanously select multiple sprints on work view

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
1. Create an issue in project JIRA(e.g. JIRA-1)
2. Create a sprint which include the JIRA-1, 
3. Start the sprint
4. Move the issue from project JIRA to another project (e.g. JIRAClone), the key of the issue became to JIRACLONE-1
5. Create another Agile board based on project JIRAClone

Result, we found out that the JIRACLone-1 still belongs to the sprint in project JIRA.

when the issue is moved from one project to another project, if the issue belongs to an active sprint, can we have a alert or warning to let the user remove the issue from the current sprint first.
fields.summary: The sprint information is not cleaned when the issue is moved

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: update docs for "Viewing an Issue" - Resolution, Environment and Security Level added to Issue Detail View

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h5. Steps to Reproduce:
* Rename a default JIRA status:
** JIRA Admin > Issues > Statuses
** Click Edit for a default JIRA status. (for e.g. "In Progress")
** Rename this to "*In progress*"
(!) Note the change is lower case "*p*".
* In GreenHopper *Create a new project and board*.
* Fill in fields as necessary and click 'Create'.
* After the new Board gets created try to configure the board: Tools > Configure
* ERROR

Initial Reported versions: JIRA 5.1.6 with GH 6.0.5
Locally Verified on: JIRA 5.1.8 with GH 6.0.6
fields.summary: Changing JIRA's default status names causes GH Simplified workflows to fail

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Please edit the following documentation: 

[GreenHopper 6.0.3 Release Notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/GreenHopper+6.0.3+Release+Notes]

The following [session|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/GreenHopper+6.0.3+Release+Notes#GreenHopper6.0.3ReleaseNotes-EasiermanagementofRemainingEstimate] under *Easier management of Remaining Estimate* is quite confusing:

{quote}
In Plan mode, the sprint footer will now display the sum of the Remaining Estimate of all of the issues and sub-tasks in the future sprint. Note that the the value will not be shown if the board is configured to use the Original Time Estimate as the Estimation Statistic and the sum of the Original Estimates on the issues is the same as the sum of the Remaining Estimates on the issues and sub-tasks.
{quote}

The last phrase in particular is really confusing.

Thanks!
Clarissa.
fields.summary: Edit the release notes for Greenhopper 6.0.3

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The workflow we use for Scrum adds an additional "Verified" step after Resolved, and the columns on the Rapidboard are set up to have In Progress and Resolved as partially complete, followed by Verified as the state for the "Done" column.

There is no direct transition from In Progress to Verified, requiring two steps to move from In Progress to Resolved to Verified. However, when all subtasks are complete on a story (that is, in the Done column), the "Move to Done" transition button appears even though the parent Story is still In Progress. 

Attempting to click Move to Done brings up a lightbox indicating there's no valid transition.

We can easily workaround this by moving the Story to Resolved first, but it seems like there's a better experience that could be put together. 

This seems to relate potentially to GHS-6063.

It should be possible to set the behaviour of the parent story to one of the either:
- be able to pre-select the status that a parent should be transitioned to when all subtasks are complete;
- disable the automated parent transition altogether.
fields.summary: "Move to Done" button appears regardless of whether the transition is valid

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a user, I want to be able to quickly bulk edit the issues associated with my sprint while within the board. 

Currently, to do this I have to:
1) navigate to a specific issue in my sprint so that I can edit it. 
2) Click on the sprint field to edit so that I know what the sprint internal ID is
3) Navigate to the issue navigator and create the query of sprint = <insert ID> 
4) perform the bulk updates
5) Then usually click on Agile > select board to return back to the board that they were working with. 

The most common bulk update is to associate a Fix Version since: 
1) You cannot edit fix version in Greenhopper
2) When you have several stories in one sprint, editing individually is time consuming
3) There is no tie between a sprint and a jira fix version.  We want to see all sprints associated with a release and a release is associated with a fix version
4) Management has no clue what sprints are in work and associated with different versions. Thus, they use fix version for dashboard reporting; but, to use those, they need to have sprints tied to fixversion

The issues with the above stpes:
1) No user has any idea how to create a sprint query as no user expects to have to locate an internal ID reference.  Then, you have to know how to get it since you cannot get to it within Greenhopper

2) The users want to stay in the context of their board as they are usually doing planning. 

The user wants to have a bulk edit action of all selected sprint items to be able to use to make any updates. (whether they are fixversion updates, assignment changes, etc.)
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to easily bulk edit my sprint content

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
After upgrading to the latest version of GH (6.0.6) we are getting "Issue Ranking Operation log entry found where none expected. Please restart JIRA." errors. After restarting Jira the error is gone. If we thereafter rank some issues to top (via the normal Jira issue edit action), switch to GH and there to "plan" view the error is triggered from time to time (non deterministic). Seems to be introduced by the upgrade to 6.0.6.

This renders the issue ranking operation useless - a real show stopper.

"Work" view is still usable.
fields.summary: Repeated "Issue Ranking Operation log entry found where none expected. Please restart JIRA." when switching to "Plan" view.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
...even if I'm using story points for user story estimates, so that I can easily check the total work load during sprint planning. 

We use story points for user story estimates, and hours for the tasks the stories are broken down to during sprint planning. We then check the total amount of hours vs the available capacity for the team (accounting for holidays etc). 

Today we have to calculate the total amount of hours manually (summing the total shown on each story), but it would be nice to have the amount of hours estimated for the sprint shown next to the totals for the story points and number of issues totals for a sprint on the Plan board.
fields.summary: As a product owner I would like to see the sum of the estimated time remaining for all issues in both a planned and running sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Start with an instance which has GreenHopper installed and the Epic issue type created by GreenHopper
# Delete all issues of type Epic
# Delete Epic Issue Type via JIRA admin
# Enable Epics Support labs feature
# Go to an Agile Board and go to Plan Mode

You will see a red error message "Internal Server Error" and no Plan Mode information will be displayed. In the console and server logs you will find this stack trace:

{code}
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 2012-11-02 15:29:30,144 http-2990-6 ERROR admin 929x3476x1 17uppd5 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1%0 /rest/greenhopper/1.0/xboard/plan/backlog/data.json [common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] java.lang.NullPointerException
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.rapid.RapidViewClauseServiceImpl.getPlanModeClause(RapidViewClauseServiceImpl.java:108)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.rapid.RapidViewClauseServiceImpl.getClauseForBuilder(RapidViewClauseServiceImpl.java:70)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.rapid.RapidViewQueryServiceImpl.getBacklogQuery(RapidViewQueryServiceImpl.java:189)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.rapid.RapidViewQueryServiceImpl.getBacklogQuery(RapidViewQueryServiceImpl.java:167)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.list.RapidIssueEntryQueryServiceImpl.collectBacklogIssues(RapidIssueEntryQueryServiceImpl.java:165)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.plan.PlanningModeResource.loadBacklogData(PlanningModeResource.java:220)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.plan.PlanningModeResource.access$300(PlanningModeResource.java:59)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.plan.PlanningModeResource$1.call(PlanningModeResource.java:130)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.plan.PlanningModeResource$1.call(PlanningModeResource.java:115)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.util.RestCall.response(RestCall.java:48)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.AbstractResource.response(AbstractResource.java:48)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.plan.PlanningModeResource.getBacklogData(PlanningModeResource.java:114)
{code}

*Workaround*

Refer to the following KB article to fix the Epic issue type association in database:

[Unable to access Planning mode due to at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.rapid.RapidViewClauseServiceImpl.getPlanModeClause|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/Unable+to+access+Planning+mode+due+to+at+com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.rapid.RapidViewClauseServiceImpl.getPlanModeClause]
fields.summary: Internal Server Error when accessing Plan Mode with Epics enabled

fields.description:
From my agile planning board, I create an epic and assign tasks to it. I then decide that I do not need that epic, so I delete it. The contents of all sprints and backlog is cleared, and there is no way to get them back unless I recreate the epic again.

After further investigation the problem is that if I click on the epic in the agile board, and then choose to open in Jira, then delete, the agile board 'remembers' that I had selected the epic, and still tries to filter by it. If I only have one epic there is no other epic to choose, therefore the filtering is incorrect.
fields.summary: Delete epic causes backlog and sprint items to disappear

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-6471].
  {panel}

 In GreenHopper, it is possible for us to configure the a scrum board filter to include other projects, or only include certain issues of a project by attributes as needed. Because of this, there's a possibility that users may accidentally include a sub task to a Sprint while actually the parent task is excluded from the Sprint. When this scenario happen, the following error will be produced if we try to generate a Sprint Report:
!scshot1.png!

A simple steps to reproduce the problem:
- Create a new project with 1 issue having 1 subtask
- Create a scrum board for the project
- Go to the Plan board and include the parent issue in a Sprint (subtask won't be displayed in the plan board). Start the Sprint
- Modify the board filter (Configure > Filter > View in Issue Navigator), exclude the parent task from the filter. Save.
- Back to the Scrum, try to generate Sprint Report and the problem is reproducible.

It'll be great if we have the feature to exclude a sub task if the parent issue is not included, or add a more meaningful message that may help customer to understand the root cause of the problem. 

h3. Workaround
Remove the subtask without the parent from the JIRA Agile (formerly GreenHopper) board. Identifying the problematic issues is not a trivial process, and can be done with either of the following workarounds:

h5. Using JQL

# Identify the board which is causing the problems and copy the filter from it in *Board > Configure > Filter > Filter Query*. For example:
{noformat}
project = "Sample Scrum Project" ORDER BY Rank ASC
{noformat}
# Add {{AND type not in subTaskIssueTypes()}} to it (see the below example) and then search for that filter in the Issue Navigator, so as to return all the parent issues.
{noformat}
project = "Sample Scrum Project" AND type not in subTaskIssueTypes() ORDER BY Rank ASC
{noformat}
# Those issuekeys will need be collected and collated for comparison against a filter again. This can either by done by exporting the results to CSV and extracting them from there, or by using the Javascript in step 4 & 5.
# Using Chrome, open the [Chrome Developer Tools|https://developers.google.com/chrome-developer-tools/docs/overview#access], select the console and add the following Javascript to it. Make sure to press enter after adding the Javascript.
{code:javascript}
AJS.$(document).ajaxSuccess(function(e, obj) { try{ console.log(JSON.parse(obj.responseText).issueTable.issueKeys.join(',')) } catch(e) {} })
{code}
(i) You should see the below appear after entering to confirm the JS went through:
!Document.png!
# Reload to filter and the issue keys will be put together in the console as below:
!Issues.png!
# Take those issue keys and add them into the JQL query from step 2, put them inside the {{and parent not in ()}} section and change the {{not in subTaskIssueTypes()}} to {{in subTaskIssueTypes()}}. See the below example:
{noformat}
project = "Sample Scrum Project" AND type in subTaskIssueTypes() and parent not in (SSP-1,SSP-2,SSP-3,SSP-4,SSP-5,SSP-6,SSP-8,SSP-9,SSP-10,SSP-13,SSP-14,SSP-15,SSP-16,SSP-17,SSP-18,SSP-19,SSP-20,SSP-21,SSP-22,SSP-23) ORDER BY Rank ASC
{noformat}
(i) This will search for all parent issues that do not exist within the board.
# Remove those subtasks from the board.

h5. Using SQL

In order to find out all the subtasks without their parent, you may use the following queries: 
# Run the following query in the database and get the id of the subtask link: 
{code:sql}
SELECT * 
FROM   issuelinktype 
WHERE  linkname LIKE '%subtask%'; 
{code}
# After this run the following query in the database, substituting the value for 'Link Type Id' by the id derived from the above SQL:
*Before JIRA 6.1:*
{code:sql}
SELECT ji2.pkey AS "parent issue key", 
       ji1.pkey AS "child issue key" 
FROM   issuelink il 
       JOIN jiraissue ji1 
         ON ji1.id = il.destination 
       JOIN jiraissue ji2 
         ON ji2.id = il.source 
WHERE  il.linktype = <Link Type Id>;
{code}
*After JIRA 6.1:*
{code:sql}
SELECT p.pkey AS "parent project key",
    ji2.issuenum AS "parent issue num",
    q.pkey AS "child project key", 
       ji1.issuenum AS "child issue num" 
FROM   issuelink il 
       JOIN jiraissue ji1 
         ON ji1.id = il.destination 
       JOIN jiraissue ji2 
         ON ji2.id = il.source 
       JOIN project p
        ON ji1.project = p.id
       JOIN project q
        ON ji2.project = q.id 
WHERE  il.linktype = <Link Type Id>;
{code}

(i) This query will list all the sub task type of issues with their parents. You can now compare the subtasks from your filter query and verify if their parents are present on the board by looking up their parent id from the query results.
fields.summary: GreenHopper shouldn't allow sub task to be listed in the scrum board if the parent issue is excluded

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: As a product owner/scrum master, I'd like to have gadgets to be linked to Agile boards that provide the same options as the ones discontinued on Jira 7.0. A great example is the Burndown Gadget, which now doesn't allow for an overview of burn down in more than one sprint by linking it to a JQL filter of my choice.
fields.summary: Actual replacements for Classic Agile Gadgets

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: As a product owner, I'd like a project progress gadget for the new boards (similar to the classic project progress gadget)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
- this is to mimic the behaviour of the burndown chart of the board

# The sprint value can be chosen by the user. The default value is auto (the one that ends first)
# No configuration to change estimation statistic
# Needs to be wallboard compatible
# Call it "Sprint Burndown" gadget

(!) Development Notes (!)

Q: Will Wallboard Mode be compatible for all supported browsers (IE specifically)?
A: (/) Works but with some adjustments on IE8 (because of quirks mode)

Q: What if a user does not have permission to see a project configured in the gadget? (either a single project or one out of multi-project board)
A: (/) Will get an error message saying that the board can not be find

Q: What if the sprint has run over its end-date?
A: (/) Same as burndown chart

Q: Does the y-axis adjust if there is scope addition? Do the tickmarks readjust?
A: (/) Yes, thanks to flot

Q: What if there is no active sprint?
A: (/)  Displays a message like "could not find an active sprint"

Q: What if the active sprint has only issues that are in a project that the user does not have permission for?
A: (/) Will get an error message saying that the board can not be find

Q: Can the user hover over data points in the chart?
A: (/) The user can't for now
fields.summary: As a product owner, I'd like a burndown gadget for the new boards (similar to the existing Classic Burndown gadget)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
# Same defaults when choosing the sprint as in GHS-6467
# Needs to take non-working days into account (we should make it explicit in the description of the gadget)
# Mimic behaviour of classic version of the gadget otherwise
# Wallboard compatible
# Call it "Days Remaining in Sprint" gadget

(!) Development Notes (!)
Q: What happens if a user doesn't have permission to access a project in the gadget?
A: (/) No permission error message?

Q: Will the days remaining be calculated in the server timezone or adjusted to user timezone? (I think it would have to follow the server timezone to be accurate for remote teams)
A: (/) User's timezone

Q: Do the days remaining honor the time of day that the sprint ends?
A: (/) Yes

Q: What is displayed if there is no active sprint?
A: (/) No active sprint error message

Q: What is displayed if the sprint has been closed?
A: (/) 0 Days Remaining
fields.summary: As a product owner, I'd like a days remaining in sprint gadget for the new boards (similar to the days remaining gadget)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: As a product owner, I'd like a cumulative flow chart gadget that can show the flow for a new board (similar to the classic cumulative flow chart gadget for the new boards)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: As a product owner, I'd a gadget that scrolls individual stories from a sprint (i.e the card view gadget to work with the new boards)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
COS:
- Also remember your 'All' or 'Custom' preference for fields 
- None of this applies to the Create Epic dialog

(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: What happens if you switch modes or go to config before you create an issue? Aka how long do we queue up this memory?
A: It's reset when the dialog is hidden. If you refresh the page with the dialog open, it doesn't get reset. 

Q: What happens if you edit an issue first, changing the fields that are shown there, then try quick create?
A: Quick Edit and Quick Create customisation are independent.

Q: What happens when you open the create dialog but then close it, and reopen again to actually create?
A: (/) it's good

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: There is a ridiculous amount of carpal-tunnel creating work involved in stopping a sprint and moving on to the next one. Every issue which remains unfinished has to be manually dragged up into the new sprint. How likely is an unfinished item to not be in the new sprint? Why aren't they autopopulated there in planning mode?
fields.summary: Move all items in completed sprint to the new sprint.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently only POST is supported for /quickfilters/{rapidViewId}
If GET was implemented, then a developer could easily fetch current quickfilters for a board.
fields.summary: As a developer I would like to access quickfilters via REST

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The classic boards allowed easy creation of a new issue that had fields set based on the context of the current board.  This had the effect that issues are created within the current sprint without people having to think about it.

With the RapidBoards this is no longer the case, only the top level "Create Issue" link is still available which appears to be unaware of its context. This is causing frustration within our teams.
fields.summary: As a user I want to easily add new issues to the current sprint from the RapidBoards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
With a single team working through a backlog, it makes perfect sense to have a single RapidBoard restricted to one active sprint.  We operate with two teams running off a single backlog and can't see how to do so effectively from the RapidBoard.

Ideally we'd all use the same RapidBoard and set the "active sprint" limit to 2 so that both teams can have a sprint active.

Instead we figured that each team would create a separate RapidBoard pointing at the same backlog but now it seems that the 2nd team still sees the 1st team's open sprint and is blocked from creating a new one.  How are we supposed to operate two teams from a single backlog?

If we're going to be forced down the route of maintaining per-team backlogs then we're going to need some better tools for managing multiple backlogs and easily moving issues between them.

(All of this works quite easily with per-team sub-versions in the classic boards btw)
fields.summary: As a user I want to run multiple sprints concurrently so that multiple teams can work from a single backlog

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Atm we have to add certain fields everytime we create a new Scrum Rapid board. It would save a lot of time, to be able to add to the default created boards, so fields always needed didn't have to be added everytime.
fields.summary: Change default issue details view

At the moment it seems that rapid boards do not allow configuring the fields which appear on the cards in the rapid board.

For that reason, I'm still using the Classic view.

2 questions:

1. When is the classic view going to be removed, if ever?
2. When are the cards in rapid boards going to be configurables?
fields.summary: Configuring fields which appear on cards in rapid board

fields.description:
COS: 
- Need separate scrolling for long Epic lists

(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: What happens if there are error messages in the page as well?
A: (/) Error messages have an absolute position so they are not influenced by the epics pane.

Q: How well does this work with all browsers?
A: (/) Tested on IE8, IE9, last Firefox, last Safari and last Chrome.

Q: What happens when the epics tab is very long and you scroll in it or in the main pane?
A: (/) The epics pane has its own scrollbar, so when the content is longer than the available visible height, a scrollbar appears.

Q: Try a combination of clicks and scrolls with epics/issues selected.
A: (/) Bad behaviour when the view port is smaller than the minimum JIRA supported size, but it is normal.

Q: What happens if the detail view is closed?
A: (/) The epic pane is not influenced by the detail view.

fields.description:
As a user, I would like to have a consistent, and accurate message displayed when I have configured my rapid board to show no issues. Examples:

1. My quick filter results in nothing appearing in the backlog. Currently, the message shown is: "There are currently no issues in the backlog" This should be improved to say: "There are currently no issues in the backlog which match your quick filter."

2. I select an Epic with no sub issues. Currently, there is no message shown at all. This message should be added to meet the same format: "There are currently no issues in the backlog which match your selected Epic."

Another possible implementation method would be to take the WIP issue count from Kanban boards and apply it to the backlog as well. Screenshot of this attached. Though telling a user what is causing them to be hidden may also be helpful.
fields.summary: Improve user feedback when no issues are on Rapid Board

This will increase our efficieny with prioritizing things within particular versions rather than always having to pull things and order them from the huge backlog.

* On the rapid borad is from the newest one to the oldest one. 

This will actually confused the users.
fields.summary: The comment list in the rapid board should order with the same timeline method as in the issue page

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-6414].
  {panel}

Basically, it does not respect the subtasks of the same parent available in JIRA, but *only* looking of the subtask with the same parent issue on the board. If you have different *Boards* with one parent issue and many subtasks in other boards, moving one of those sub-tasks to the *Done* column will enforce the parent issue to be *Resolved* even though not all *Sub-Takses* are done. 

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create project and board project_A and board_A
# Create board_B that show project_A
# Create board_C that show project_A
# Create one task with two sub tasks it project_A
# Set filters in board_B and board_C so each one of them will show one sub task
# In one of the board_B or board_C move the sub task to done
# A popup message will appear saying *All sub-tasks for parent issue XXXXX-1 are now Done*. Even only *one* sub-task is done and the others not yet.

This is also reproducible when a user divide a Board into two for the same project and workflow. Example, create a Developer Board and QA board where the Resolved/Closed JIRA status is available only in QA board. It will still prompt to closed the parent issue even if the parent issue is NOT in the same board.
fields.summary: Parent issue enforced to be resolved even though not all the sub-tasks are done

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Have created Sprint but now I have no permission to do manage sprints:

# I've created one Board using only Project A (that I'm admin),
# I've created one "Sprint 1" and put some issues inside,
# Then... I've changed the filter to include Project B (that I'm not admin),
# I put some more issues inside "Sprint 1", from Project B,
# I want to manage Sprint (create more, complete, change dates) => No permission,
# So, once again I change permissions to include only Project A,
# I want to manage Sprint (create more, complete, change dates) => No permission.

Now I have created a Board and a "Sprint 1" and can't do anything, so:

# I deleted the board,
# I've create a new board,
# The "Sprint 1" was already there, and again, I can't change it.

I'm managing the work of a specialized team across different projects that I'm not administrator. For me, the administration permission requirement doesn't make any sense.
fields.summary: Created a Sprint but now I've no permission to manage it

fields.description:
Need to modify how this calculation is done so that the operation will offer to take users to Plan Mode.

Q : Would the epic be selected? That could be strange as it would apply filtering.
A : no, the epic is not selected

(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: Make sure to be searching by an issue id, not epic name to prevent searching on duplicate names.
A: (/) sure, searched by issue id

Q: How performant is this across many boards, like JAC?
A: (/) hard to say, but we basically added only one clause to the query. It shouldn't perform very differently from what is already deployed on JAC. Needs verification tough.

Q: What if the Epics Panel is collapsed?
A: (/) the panel is opened and the epic is selected. It means that issues that are not in the epic are filtered out

Q: What if the user does not have permission to see a board/project that the Epic is involved with?
A: (x) [~pobara], not sure how to produce this case, let's speak together about that

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
To replicate the exact error, one must access the URL http://<BASE-URL>/secure/GHGoToBoard.jspa with the IssueID argument. The URL generally has an argument, as in http://<BASE-URL>/secure/GHGoToBoard.jspa?issueId=10001.  Without the argument (issueId=10001), JIRA will throw a null value error. 

{noformat}
2012-09-19 09:47:00,328 http-8080-8 ERROR anonymous 587x91259x3 - xx.xxx.xx.xx,127.0.0.1 /secure/GHGoToBoard.jspa [velocity] Left side ($action.numBoards) of '==' operation has null value. If a reference, it may not be in the context. Operation not possible. templates/greenhopper/web/board/rapid/board-selector.vm [line 8, column 69]
2012-09-19 09:47:00,703 http-8080-4 ERROR anonymous 587x91263x1 - xx.xxx.xx.xx,127.0.0.1 /secure/GHGoToBoard.jspa [velocity] Left side ($action.numBoards) of '==' operation has null value. If a reference, it may not be in the context. Operation not possible. templates/greenhopper/web/board/rapid/board-selector.vm [line 8, column 69]
2012-09-19 09:47:00,971 http-8080-47 ERROR anonymous 587x91266x2 - xx.xxx.xx.xx,127.0.0.1 /secure/GHGoToBoard.jspa [velocity] Left side ($action.numBoards) of '==' operation has null value. If a reference, it may not be in the context. Operation not possible. templates/greenhopper/web/board/rapid/board-selector.vm [line 8, column 69]
{noformat}

JIRA should be robust against incorrect URLs.

The following condition check in the board-selector.vm will throw an incompatible format error:
{code}
        #if ($action.hasAnyErrors() == false || $action.numBoards == 0)
            ##POSSIBLEXSS
            <script>
                ## Fire analytics event for loading the board selector page
                (function(){
{code}

As the numBoards is currently return a NULL value rather than a numeric value.


h3. The fix

It seems that this has been fixed in JIRA 5.1.x as it uses a new velocity render
fields.summary: "board-selector.vm" velocity file does not handle empty value properly
